org.eclipse.keyple.core.plugin

Interface SmartSelectionReader

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ProxyReader, Reader

    public interface SmartSelectionReader
extends ProxyReader
    Interface implemented by readers able to handle natively the card selection process.

    Android OMAPI based readers are for example able to do this.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void closeLogicalChannel()
      Closes the logical channel explicitly.
      byte[] openChannelForAid(byte[] dfName, byte isoControlMask)
      Opens a logical channel for the provided AID

      • Methods inherited from interface org.eclipse.keyple.core.card.message.ProxyReader

      • Methods inherited from interface org.eclipse.keyple.core.service.Reader

        activateProtocol, deactivateProtocol, getName, isCardPresent, isContactless

    • Method Detail

      • openChannelForAid

        byte[] openChannelForAid(byte[] dfName,
                         byte isoControlMask)
        Opens a logical channel for the provided AID

        The dfName is provided as a byte array. It can be set to null to activate the basic channel opening defined by the OMAPI.
        The bit mask indicates the ISO defined condition to retrieve the selection data.

        Parameters:
        dfName - A byte array or null
        isoControlMask - bit mask from
        Returns:
        A byte array containing the card answer to selection
        Throws:
        KeypleReaderIOException - if the communication with the reader or the card has failed

      • closeLogicalChannel

        void closeLogicalChannel()
        Closes the logical channel explicitly.
